page.title: 14YOUTH HOSTELS
page.content: In Ruckland there is a 'simple' grade youth hostel called 'Woody's Top', marked on some maps as 'Top Barn', which indicates its previous use. It has twenty beds in three dormitories, and amenities are basic but well-planned. Many improvements, including damp-proofing, a new dormitory extension and a new kitchen set in the former dormitory, have been made in the past year. Water has to be 'carted' from a nearby farm. However, a new mains supply to the village has been installed, and it is intended to connect the hostel in the near future. It is only wardened in the summer on Saturdays nights, but individuals and groups can book in at other times. It provides a good base for school parties and is popular with cyclists.
